intro: Vitex orinocensis var. multiflora, commonly known as the Orinoco vitex, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming in the spring and summer. It is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and floral displays.
